!blender: Yes, yes.
do you know what would cause my ubuntu to fail to load the gui?
uh, lots of things? Does it give you an error message?
so it gives you the CLI rather than a display manager?
log in from the command line. Then, run "startx". Pastebin whatever errors it gives you.
XIO: Fatal IO error 104 ( Connection reset by peer) on X server ":0.0" after 0 requests (0 known processed) with 0 events remaining
no screens found seems to indicate you're using the wrong driver for your card, or trying to use options your card does not support. Are you sure you're using the correct driver?
do you at least know what card you have?
okay, run "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" and make sure to specify radeon driver.
should I do Startx again after the configuration or?
of course, if you want to try starting X. =P
what's the output of "cat /var/log/Xorg.0.log | grep EE"?
the output is (II) Loading extension MIT-SCREEN-SAVER then (EE) No devices detected
I hate to doubt you, but are you sure you have the right card? Please post the output of "lspci" and also "cat /etc/X11/xorg.conf | grep Driver"
that's your problem. Your sound card is not detected by the kernel. It's unsupported.
unless you're running a really old kernel, I would say for at least a few months to a year, that machine ain't running any Linux.
is it a brand new video card?
firstly, upgrade to ubuntu dapper
secondly, try the fglrx drivers from ATI.
to do that, apt-cache search fglrx and install all which looks relevant.
all which looks relevant = linux-restricted-modules-`uname -r` and xorg-driver-fglrx
